info.name: Subthalamus
info.description: The subthalamus is one of the four divisions of the diencephalon.  It is located ventral to the thalamus, lateral to the hypothalamus and medial to the internal capsule and cerebral peduncle.  It contains the subthalamic nucleus and the zona incerta.  It is traversed by the somatosensory pathways on their way to the thalamus as well as by pathways connecting the cerebellum and basal ganglia.  It is continuous caudally with rostral portions of the red nucleus and substantia nigra.
